description.narrative: By 2021, WCARO will have raised the consciousness of key external audiences on the importance of equitable investments in children and will have created opportunities for supporters and influencers to take action and support the cause of children in West and Central Africa., which contributes to Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: COMMUNICATION AND PUBLIC ADVOCACY, PARTNERSHIP, RESOURCE MOBILISATION

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
West and Central Africa Regional Evaluation Reports
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, WCARO will have raised the consciousness of key external audiences on the importance of equitable investments in children and will have created opportunities for supporters and influencers to take action and support the cause of children in West and Central Africa.

description.narrative: During this second year of the implementation of the regional Key Results for Children, the Communication and Public Advocacy section worked closely with Programmes and country offices to support their efforts towards achieving the regional goals, including by strengthening advocacy capacities in the region. Striking a balance between a narrative calling attention to challenges while highlighting progress was at the core of our strategy. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of people reached on UNICEF social media channels
Number of followers across UNICEF social media channels
Number of users on UNICEF website
Percentage of returning visitors to UNICEF websites
Number of initiatives that engage civil society partners and/or coalitions to advocate together with UNICEF for children
Number of articles/stories with UNICEF mentions in top-tier media outlets
Share of voice on children-related issues in traditional media
